alert.note: Alert for Inland Martin; Okeechobee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 6:20PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of extreme southeastern Okeechobee and western Martin Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 619 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near J And S Fish Camp, moving east at 10 mph. Other strong storms will push east from Lake Okeechobee into western Martin county. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... J And S Fish Camp and Port Mayaca. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
